location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 6; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 3-5; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains the copy of a letter forwarded by the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf to the Political Agent at Bahrain. The letter, written by the Secretary General Post Office to the Foreign Office, in London, concerns the introduction of a trans-desert mail service between Damascus and Bagdad, twice a week.
